events.description: "This is one of the worst moments of my life." I got kicked out of a summer visual arts program and I felt like a ghost.
"This has been the best summer of my life." A well-adjusted season of music, in-jokes and crepuscular activity.
"Experiencing great highs and suffering tremendous lows." Holding onto someone who wasn't holding onto me.
"My dad works around the corner from where I temp and he buys me lunch and I buy him dessert." Free lunches with dad.

"I've had six good days since mid-May and I should have either learned to drive or done sit ups or gotten a job or learned PHP or visited Massachusetts or at least just left my house." Dropped out of college for a little while.
"We had a small dance party." Two other girls and I shared an apartment intended for six. Within the first three weeks we had all been jilted. Ice cream and parties ensued for three months.

"The professor was really impressed with me and we talked for a long time." A full year of Organic Chemistry in 10 weeks is remarkably easy when you're studying for 11 hours a day with your best friends and completely limerent over your professor.
"Hello. I am living through the lowest part of my 20s." I lost everything this summer.
I finally got around to listening to Beach House's Teen Dream the week a friend from high school died.
"I put up a wall. That was three years ago." I woke up.
"I hope the grief over that is short-lived." The grief over that WAS short lived.
